infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_initializer: If the map is not initialized by using any external lua scripts, the initializer will be used to initialize the map.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_allowrespawn: When ‖color:gui.blue‖signal_in‖end‖ receives ‖color:gui.yellow‖"0"‖end‖ will disable respawn-ability for the specified factions, otherwise enabling.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_addorremovejob: When ‖color:gui.blue‖signal_in‖end‖ receives ‖color:gui.yellow‖"0"‖end‖ will remove the specified jobs from the specified factions, otherwise adding. Use ‖color:gui.orange‖,‖end‖ separator to split factions and jobs.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_addorremovegear: When ‖color:gui.blue‖signal_in‖end‖ receives ‖color:gui.yellow‖"0"‖end‖ will remove the specified gears from the specified jobs, otherwise adding. Use ‖color:gui.orange‖,‖end‖ separator to split jobs and gears.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_teleporter: Teleporting a character requires wiring to make it work. It has no actual texture, but it has resizable interaction range and teleportation switch that can be turned on/off. Some decorations can usually be placed as the appearance of the teleporter. When a signal generated by a character is sent to the signal input of a teleporter, that character will be teleported to the location of the teleporter.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_datagetter: It receives a signal and get a global data by the ‖color:gui.yellow‖DataIndex‖end‖, if no data got, it's default to ‖color:gui.yellow‖DefaultData‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_datasetter: It receivers a signal and stores its value to global by the ‖color:gui.yellow‖DataIndex‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_characterchecker: Link to ‖color:0.2,0.2,1.0‖Region+‖color:end‖ or ‖color:0.4,0.4,0.4‖Region-‖color:end‖ to create a group of the regions, when receiving a signal, output the count of ‖color:gui.blue‖characters‖end‖ matching the conditions in the regions.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_charactersingleche: It receives a signal sent by a character, if the character matches the conditions, the character will be used as the source to send signals respectively: ‖color:gui.blue‖signal value, character GUID, character name, character species name, character group and character tags.‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_actionendgame: End game when receive a signal.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_actionsendchatmess: Send a message to a player when receive a signal, filter recipients based on their properties.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_evententerleavereg: Link to ‖color:0.2,0.2,1.0‖Region+‖color:end‖ or ‖color:0.4,0.4,0.4‖Region-‖color:end‖ to create a group of the regions, when a character enters or leaves the regions, the character will be used as the source to send signals respectively: ‖color:gui.blue‖character GUID, character name, character species name, character tags, "0" or "1"("0" is leaving, "1" is entering)‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_eventcharacterdeat: When a character dies, the character will be used as the source to send signals respectively: ‖color:gui.blue‖dead GUID, dead name, dead species name, dead group, dead tags, killer GUID, killer name, killer species name, killer group, killer tags‖end‖.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_characterresponder: Property ‖color:gui.yellow‖Chunk (Response Callback)‖end‖ loads a lua chunk/block, when receive a signal and if its source is a character, the loaded chunk will be called with the character as first argument. Support linking to ‖color:0.2,0.2,1.0‖Region+‖color:end‖ or ‖color:0.4,0.4,0.4‖Region-‖color:end‖ to create a group of the regions, the chunk will also handle all matching characters in the region.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_charactercleaner: When ‖color:gui.blue‖signal_in‖end‖ receives a signal, all characters found to should be cleared will be recorded once. If the number of times a character is recorded reaches the threshold, the character will be removed. Appropriate and reasonable usage can reduce unnecessary lag in the game. Link to ‖color:0.2,0.2,1.0‖Region+‖color:end‖ or ‖color:0.4,0.4,0.4‖Region-‖color:end‖ to constrain the search scope of the character.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_itemcleaner: When ‖color:gui.blue‖signal_in‖end‖ receives a signal, all items found to should be cleared will be recorded once. If the number of times an item is recorded reaches the threshold, the item will be removed. Appropriate and reasonable usage can reduce unnecessary lag in the game. It's required to determine at least one tag group for constructing a cleanup rule. Use commas ‖color:gui.orange‖,‖end‖ as separators to add multiple tag groups, and use vertical bars ‖color:gui.orange‖|‖end‖ to define tags within a group. when ‖color:gui.yellow‖Tags‖end‖ or ‖color:gui.yellow‖Identifier‖end‖ of an item maches all the tags in one of the tag groups, the item will be recorded once.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_itembuilder: Property ‖color:gui.yellow‖Item Builds‖end‖ loaded a lua table that describe the process of spawning items. When receive a signal and its source is a character, all items will spawn in the inventory of the character, otherwise spawning at the location of the item builder. Link to ‖color:0.2,0.2,1.0‖Region+‖color:end‖ to create a group of the regions as the range of spawning.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_itembatch: Property ‖color:gui.yellow‖Item Batch Unit‖end‖ loaded a lua table that describe the process of batching items. When receive a signal, all linked items will be batched. Except for that, if the sender of the signal is a character, it will batch all items in the inventory of the character.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_lua2component: With 32 parallel IOs, upvalues ​​are accessed through closure contexts, which reduces performance burden and removes environment constraints.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_scriptwearabledyei: When a character equips an item, its color changes.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_scriptwifiinitiali: When a wifi component is created, changes its ‖color:gui.yellow‖Wifi Channel‖end‖ and ‖color:gui.yellow‖TeamID‖end‖, Link to ‖color:0.2,0.2,1.0‖Region+‖color:end‖ or ‖color:0.4,0.4,0.4‖Region-‖color:end‖ to constrain the search scope of the spawned wifi component. Support constructing a cleanup rule similar to ‖color:0.1,0.5,0.5‖Item Cleaner‖color:end‖ for matching the item of the wifi component.
infotexts.entitydescription.dfc_scriptsubmarineloc: Lock the submarine where the current script is located.
infotexts.sp.dfcteleporter.teleportable.descriptio: Disable to teleport when the value is false.
infotexts.sp.dfcteleporter.cooldown.description: Global cooldown time to wait after teleporting.
infotexts.sp.dfcsynchronous.allowsynchronization.d: Allow synchronized signal output in Multiplayer (recommended to disable if not necessary).
infotexts.sp.dfccharacterresponder.chunk.descripti: It's required to return a chunk. The responded character will be passed in the first parameter of the function.
infotexts.sp.dfccharacterresponder.applytosender.d: Can response to the sender of the signal?
infotexts.sp.dfccharacterresponder.group.descripti: Character responders with the same value will be grouped into a group. If a character has been responded to by a character responder in the same group, it cannot respond again. If the group is empty, there is no limit.
infotexts.sp.dfccharactercleaner.tolerancethreshol: Remove a character when the number of times of the character is recorded reaches its threshold.
infotexts.sp.dfcitemcleaner.tolerancethreshold.des: Remove an item when the number of times of the item is recorded reaches its tolerance threshold.
infotexts.sp.dfcitemcleaner.ignoreattached.descrip: Ignore all items attached to the wall.
infotexts.sp.dfcitemcleaner.ignorestaticbody.descr: Ignore all static items such as navigation terminal, engine, junction box and so on.
infotexts.sp.dfcitemcleaner.ignoreinitial.descript: Ignore all items initialized before the round started.
infotexts.sp.dfcitembuilder.itembuilds.description: It's required to return a lua table that describes a process of spawning items.
infotexts.sp.dfcitembuilder.onlyspawninlinkedto.de: Only spawn in the linked items.
Forces spawning at a location to be determined, rather than on the character.
infotexts.sp.dfcitembuilder.group.description: Item Builders with the same value will be grouped into a group. If a character has been responded to by a item builder in the same group, it cannot respond again. If the group is empty, there is no limit.
infotexts.sp.dfcitembatch.itembatchunit.descriptio: It's required to return a lua table that describes a process of batching items.
infotexts.sp.dfcitembatch.group.description: Item Batchs with the same value will be grouped into a group. If a character has been responded to by a item batch in the same group, it cannot respond again. If the group is empty, there is no limit.
infotexts.sp.dfcevententerleaveregion.matchafterle: Require to match the character when triggering leaving event.
infotexts.sp.dfcdatasetter.dataindex.description: A data index to set corresponding data.
infotexts.sp.dfcdatagetter.dataindex.description: A data index to get corresponding data.
infotexts.sp.dfcdatagetter.defaultdata.description: When no data got, a default data is obtained.
infotexts.sp.dfcactionsendchatmessage.onlysenderre: Only sender can receive the message.
infotexts.sp.dfcactionsendchatmessage.senderreceiv: The relationship between the sender and the recipient
infotexts.sp.dfcscriptwifiinitializer.wifichannelr: The range of random values for wifi channels
